Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joan D Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great I already reserved again for my 4 stay time at this hotel. Great cover pool and spa and nice outdoor pool. Clean and comfortable. Better than Howard Johnson, Days Inn, etc. Great price and good service. My next review will be after my next stay. I recommend to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: perdidochas
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. Not top-notch, but well worth the price. It looks like they are working hard to update things. While we were there, they were cleaning the grout around the indoor pool. Could it use work? Yes, but the beds were big (queen-sized) and comfortable, the shower had plenty of hot water (four of us took showers back to back, and I was the fourth and had plenty of hot water). The maid service was excellent. We came in the night before our reservation (our trip down was faster than I expected), and they checked us in at 2 a.m. The only downside to the place is that the breakfast buffet was not the best. The eggs weren't warm enough, and it just was lacking. The wait staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awful....Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: Lemony P
Reviews.Content: Staying here with a big group of teenagers from our high school band, they did not treat you as a regular guest. Coackroaches, bed bugs, feces, and uncleaniness run rapid. The breakfast buffet was a sad excuse for food. Watch for the pancakes....they don't absorb any sort of liquid. Also watch out for the maids, they tend to like candy. Our room had writing on the bathroom mirror from previous guests claiming to "get out" or "leave now". The room next to us had feces under their bed while we had bed bugs throughout the bed. The walls are paperthin and you need to be careful whos in the room next to you and what they will here. The water in the shower would not go down so basically if your sharing a room, you are sharing filth. The pictures of the hotel? Complete krap. The hotel is located next to a sleezy store with blocked out windows. The pool is small and uncomfortable with few people around. In our room, there was a picture in the bathroom that was hung up with some sort of masking tape. It continued to fall throughout our stay revealing cracked walls. We also experienced ripped carpeting and dirty curtains. If your wishing to stay here or are looking for a nice hotel. This is definatly not the place to stay. Take a hint and look at the rest of these reviews.....

Reviews.Title: “Best value for family Disney fun!”
Reviews.Author: Mkw97
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel is dated. It's an old establishment, but it has been well maintained. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Maid service came everyday and took good care of us. The indoor and outdoor pools are very nice, and both have full bar service. The restaurant leaves a lot to be desired, but it is no worse that the food at Disneys Pop Century. Besides, Bob Evans is down the street. The staff was very friendly. For the money, it was fantastic. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyH661
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our Spring Break in Orlando. We stayed at the Ramada Maingate i/o Disney property thinking it would save us some money. Besides, we are in the parks all day/night so why would it matter where we sleep? WRONG!! It matters!!!! We would return late at night to find no fresh towels and the coffee hadn't been replenished. Not a huge deal but when it's 1am and you're exhausted the last thing you want to do is go downstairs to get towels and coffee. Also, we had no clock in our room. We asked 2 days in a row and never received one. I left a tip every day for housekeeping thinking we'd get better service (or service at all!!) and found no improvement. Walked in one night to find a huge bottle of chlorine/bleach cleaner on our sink w/ no top on it. Fumes galore not to mention if one of my kids had found it first. Yikes!! Condition of the room is dated but expected for the price. Carpet was pulled away from the wall in the kids area and carpet in king room was damp. My kids thought it was fun to try and catch the "critters" in our room. Yep, roaches.....lovely. We will not be returning to the hotel in the future. We have learned our lesson and will stay on property in the future. I don't expect fancy and new for the price but I do think it should be CLEAN and towels, etc. should be replaced. The only bright spot was a bartender named Derek. I told him we were having a rough stay while I was ordering a drink. Gave it to me for free!! Super nice guy. Too bad the rest of the staff weren't like him.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Pima41
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in dire need of a remodel. Every aspect of the hotel grounds and interior show signs of age (not in a good way). This is probably just fine if you are bringing large groups of kids who don't care about how clean or updated the place is. For me, this is an example of "you get what you pay for" which I don't necessarily think is a bad thing. For the price it was safe and met the minimum needs that a hotel should. I will say that every staff member I came in contact with was extremely pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: jannmirch1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two kids. After the first they switched us to another room because they had a group coming in. they did comp us the $10/night "resort fee"which we didn't even know we were being charged which gave us a $60 savings. The rooms were clean enough and were serviced daily but there was no service elevator so the two elevators were very busy and were often filled by staff trying to get around. The restaurant was very poor; service was bad and the food wasn't very good. The shop in the lobby had the basics; sunscreen, flip flops and souvenirs.and its very close to Disney. But I wouldn't stay again. There are other hotels that provide the same value that are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was ok for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Misty_Nicole1982
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a great special for $37 per night. I had never had a bad experience with a Ramada and decided that since we spend barely any time in our hotel while vacationing at Disney that we didn't need anything spectacular. Then, I read the reviews and got nervous. Upon arrival I could definitely smell chlorine quite strongly in the lobby but the indoor pool was not in an inclosed room so I expected to smell pool chemicals. There was a pitcher of ice water with fruit in it sitting on the check-in counter and a friendly face smiling at me when I approached to check in. The staff memeber was on the phone but quickly addressed me and pulled up my reservation. We were in our room within minutes of arriving to the hotel. The room was definitely nothing special but I didn't expect the Hilton for $37 a night. The room was clean, the bedding was clean, and I never saw any critters. I searched for mold because my son has a mold allergy and I didn't want to have a sick guy on our Disney vacation. However, my search turned up no mold. The carpet did seem damp when we arrived but the air conditioner was running as cold as it could so I assumed it might be from the room temperature. It seemed to dry right up after we adjusted the air conditioner to a comfortable temperature. The pools were a bit cold for my preference. I swam in both the indoor and outdoor pool. The indoor pool was so cold I couldn't stay in it but the kids loved swimming in it. The outdoor pool had plenty of lounge chairs. The kids enjoyed the "beach" next to the outdoor pool. We chose not to have our room cleaned during our stay. I personally don't like the idea of having people in our room when we aren't there so we hung the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and asked the maids not to clean our room. This is something I do at most hotels because I don't want to risk that things could be misplaced. To my knowledge nobody ever went in our room. We left all of our valuable belongings sitting out and nothing was ever moved. Check out was as quick and easy as check in for us. We had no hassles. We were a bit confused by the taxes and resort fee at first but after looking it added up to the $10 per day we were expecting. I probably would stay at this hotel again but only if I got as great of a deal as we did on this trip. If I had paid the regular cost of the hotel I would probably have been more upset by the condition (broken bricks, wet carpet, noisy air conditioners, cold pools, etc.). However, I'm quite happy with the deal we got and the hotel was in the perfect location for our Disney vacation!

Reviews.Title: “MY future stay is coming up!”
Reviews.Author: Tamie L
Reviews.Content: I have a reservation to stay here IN 3 DAYS!!!!!!!!!!!!! on Saturday and now after reading the reviews I am scared to death..I have booked 2 rooms, hoping they are adjoining rooms. I am so picky about staying in hotels, I am the type of person that checks the sheets, under the mattress for bed bugs...how clean the carpet is to walk around on...hopefully they have taken in account all of the moldy problems as too my youngest daughter has allergies...I hope to be able to report later next week that I had a good experience with this hotel...Hopefully this Ramada compares well with other Ramada's I have stayed in.....WILL POST A REVIEW NEXT WEEK AFTER MY STAY Sincerely The Lowe Family from Jay FL

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break at Disney”
Reviews.Author: debdefender
Reviews.Content: Beware the "taxes and resort fees", they can be a shocker when you check out. If you need internet for anything at all, this is NOT the hotel for you, but then again, how many have been able to keep their service up to handle all the new gadgets? Those are my ONLY complaints. This hotel, for what we paid, was awesome. We picked it for it's late pool closing hours, indoor heated open till 11:00 and the outside pool open till midnight. We got a lot of use out of the pools. The bar looked great and ppl seemed to be enjoying themselves in there. Same with the eateries, enjoyed by all. Our room was clean and nice, everything working and maintained. Have to hand it to housekeeping, they saw I used a LOT of the coffee and sugars, and tripled up on ours when they cleaned. Plenty of towels to go around. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH A NIGHTMARE ENDING!”
Reviews.Author: Mari34438
Reviews.Content: My bad experience began even before I arrived at the hotel. We were scheduled to arrive on March 14, 2012 and I had been calling the hotel since the night before. On the 13th, I called the hotel more than 20 times in a two hour span and the phone was ringing off the hook and nobody was picking up. I ended up calling Ramada's corporate office and they called the hotel and told me that it was unacceptable that they were not picking up the line and that I would be able to get through. I immediately called the hotel and the person on the line was extremely rude and obnoxious. On the scheduled day of my arrival, I tried calling all morning to let them know that I would have a late check in and again, the phone was ringing off the hook and nobody ever picked up. I ended up calling their customer care department and I filed a complaint for the lack of service on the hotel's part. I should have known by this point that this was only the begining of my nightmare. Upon arrival at the hotel, I checked in with my bank card (my husband has a separate bank card number). The next day after I checked in, I balanced my checkbook first thing in the morning (as I do every day, sometimes, numerous times in the day), and I had about $250.00 in fraudulent charges for various locations in the Tampa area (including Shell gas station, a chinese restaurant, a pizza restaurant, a clothing store and a shoe store) - all made in the Tampa area and all made after I checked in to the hotel and ALL MADE WITH MY CARD NUMBER...Upon seeing these transactions, I immediately called my bank and to dispute the charges and close my account. I have now placed an active investigation with the bank to find out who made these charges. Here's the kicker, I only used the card to check in to the hotel (which by the way they charged $40.00 for the 4 nights I stayed in resort fees) and placed a hold on my card for an additional $50.00 which I have not received back yet. This was a complete nightmare and something that NOBODY SHOULD EVERY HAVE TO GO THROUGH, ESPECIALLY WHILE ON VACATION! I urge all guests of this hotel to verify all of their purchases and to make sure that everything that is charged to them either through a credit card or their bank accounts is legal and not fraudulent activity. On a separate note, the hotel left a lot to be desired. The smell of chlorine was extremely prominent in the hotel pool and you could smell the chlorine as soon as you stepped foot into the lobby from the outside. The buffet that they offer is not appealing to the eye and extremely miserly. Not a great deal of variety for the price that they charge. You are better off going across the street to Ponderosa or Sizzler (you can get the breakfast buffet for $4.99 at both places) or IHop next door where kids eat free from 4-10 p.m. if you want to go that route. The room itself was clean, but everything was very dated. The staff is also rude and not very friendly. I requested a trolly to take my luggage up to the room and upon returning the trolly, I asked one of the front desk personnel (Mayte) if it was ok to leave the trolly in the corner. Not once did she look up even after I asked several times and her co-worker next to her had to answer on her behalf. All in all, between the incident with my credit card and the stay itself I will not be returning and I strongly urge everyone that does stay there to check their credit cards and bank accounts for fraudulent activity after staying there as well. Luckily, I think I am one of the few people who balances their checkbooks every day (several times a day) and I caught this early on before more damage was done. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMD198
Reviews.Content: I don't expect the Hilton for $49.00/night, but I do expect minimal service and a healthy environment. On the plus side the cleaning staff tried hard to do a good job and front desk staff always tried to help...BUT -- Ceiling leaked in rain - contacted the hotel - nothing done. -- Wireless never worked - told me it was because so many people were trying to use it. (So provide a wide enough bandwidth that your customers CAN use it.) -- Tried to use hotel lobby provided computer - previous customer had shut it down, the CPU was locked and the front desk had no keys. Had to wait until day shift came in....(but I was leaving the hotel at 8:00 am so that was no good). -- Tried to do laundry on Saturday. The machine to buy laundry tokens wasn't working. The front desk had no tokens and I was told I had to wait until Monday. -- one of the two elevators broke down on a Saturday. For the first weekend of Florida spring break this hotel had only ONE working elevator. Give me a break. -- Not enough front desk staff. The lineup was ALWAYS long and slow. Often 1 person on in am AND between 3:00 pm and 7:00 pm when many people checking in. -- Buffet was appallingly poor and limited. Snack bar was so so. -- recognize that the smell of cholorine is a result of an indoor pool, but it was SO strong. -- marble/granite floors infront of elevator on pool level is a law suit WAITING to happen. Indeed while I was there someone took a tumble. -- told I couldn't even get my Wyndam points because I booked through a travel agency....

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CJK123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the end of February for a couple nights. This is the worst hotel I have stayed in! Our room smelled of mold, the carpet was wet, the toilet wouldn't flush and the place was dirty. The buffet was a joke, very few choices and it was all terrible tasting! The only thing this place has going for it is the staff who we found to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE SAVE YOUR VACATION”
Reviews.Author: clw9_12
Reviews.Content: checked in 3/3/12 room carpet soaked with red stuff?? toilet didnt flush, tub didnt drain, safe didnt work, room 3100 moved to rm 3096 safe didnt work, not a family suite i paid for rooms both stink and mold and wet spots on ceiling everywhere, moved to room 3025 safe can be opened just by pullin hard(thats real safe!) people smoking in rooms next to us.. and its a NO smoking place.. told front desk nothing was done.. went to do laundry washers used 3 of them @$2 each and worked okay.. but only ran like 10 mins... not 30 and dryers had to use 3 of them @$2 one did not heat up.. had to move cloths paid another $2(token) tryed calling front desk from laundry didnt want to leave my cloths.. phone didnt work at the end of the time cloths still not dry at all had to run all 3 machines AGAIN @$2 each when don now more than 2 hours still not completely dry ... went to desk to tell them the machine is down..didnt ask what one and "COULD NOT GIVE ME $2 HAD TO GIVE ME TOKEN" ( alot of help that is ). finaly got back to room 3025 after 10 at night.. and husband turned on light in bathroom and ROACHES!!!!!!!....tryed to call front desk like i have from 2 other rooms and NO ONE EVERY ANSWERS PHONE....one of the Manager/supervisor... tall women, sitting down in dinning area talking having a good time with others , walkie talkie with her .. (WHAT GOOD THAT DOES NEVER SEE THEM USE THEM..) needed a spare bed in the room that was not a suite and could not call desk ... no one answers and took them 45 mins to get spare bed...my kids where ready for bed and they just took there sweet time....They came to spray for ROACHES next day while we where out the smell was so strong of spray.. it was pretty bad...we sprayed anything we could and smell didnt go away... we had to think ..was that good for us and our kids to smell... we didnt call to complan we slept with lights on so roaches would not come and out and check out day couldnt come fast enough....SAVE YOUR VACTION STAY SOMEWHERE ELES... THIS PLACE SHOULD BE TAKEN DOWN... NOT A HEALTHY PLACE TO STAY...

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: muto4
Reviews.Content: Awful awful nothing it says it is .... Dirty dirty hallways smell like urine ... Shuttle is not what it says... I will be calling corporate and be making a formal complaint! Checking out as we speak never so happy to be leaving!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Would rather sleep in my van than stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: Came to Orlando to celebrate my son's 2nd birthday. Was traveling with my 3 kids and my friend and her 2 grandkids. Contacted the hotel 3 times to see if my friend and I could have rooms near each other. Got a different answer each time - 1st that I had to call the morning of my arrival, 2nd that I had to wait till I got there and then upon emailing the address on my reservation, received a response from someone named 'Wes' saying we were all set. Upon arrival, had to wait in a horrendous line to check in with only one clerk manning the front desk during the spring break season. When we finally reached the clerk and asked about the accomodations I was promised, he said that my friend's room was already assigned and there was nothing he could do. We ended up on the same floor, but at opposite ends. My friend's grandson has cerebral palsy and it was important that our rooms be close together, not only for our convenience, but also because he has great difficulty walking long distances. Upon entering the room, the first thing I saw when I turned on the light in the bathroom was a cockroach crawling on the toilet seat. Aside from that, the carpet in my room was filthy, walls dingy and overall appearance of the room so disgusting that I wouldn't allow my kids to sit on or touch anything while I called the front desk to speak to a manager. After being put on hold for 10 minutes, I spoke to the manager who said she would not penalize me if I left, but my friend, who in her opinion wasn't experiencing the same problems as me, would be charged for one night. I told her my friend's room was not much better than mine and it was ridiculous as we hadn't even been at the hotel for 15 minutes. She then reluctantly said if we left immediately we would not be charged. We then had to cut our trip short because we could only find a hotel that would accomodate us for that night and not the whole weekend. I was embarrased to have brought my friend to this hotel and in the future will stay where she recommended - Seralago Resort (a Disney Good Neighbor hotel). I honestly thought that the Ramada was a nice hotel. When I told people that I planned on staying, they said "Wow, the Ramada!". You can imagine my disappointment upon arriving and having such a terrible experience. I do not plan on ever returning there again and if one of my friends told me they planned to stay there, I would recommend they cancel their reservation and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the hassle at check in! much to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: sarahpoo
Reviews.Content: Not worth the terrible wait to che k in and then told I might nit be able to state after thehassle I had booking a reservation! My daughter dis not get the gift bag as site stated andthe restaurant is literally right beside the heated pool and looked gross! Room was ok not that good and the outdorpool had a rancid smell around it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EmNGUYEN
Reviews.Content: Do not think about staying at this hotel. Absolutely horrendous for a Ramada hotel. We expected much better but already prepaid for the cost and were too tired to look for alternative accomodation. There are no decent things to say and we received some free hotel food vouchers which we will not use. Given that the rooms look so unclean and mildewy, I cannot think of what could be in the food they provide. Sleeping in our car or out on the beach would have been more suitable. This review was given to spare any other poor soul from having to spend a night here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Canaan L
Reviews.Content: Ramada should be ashamed to have this hotel as a part of their chain. While the staff was very friendly, the accommodations at this hotel were terrible. We were looking for a cheaper hotel to spend the night at after our flight arrived at 12:30am. At $100 you expect to have clean sheets without holes, a clean floor that looks as though it has been vacuumed and maybe a TV that works. None of the former were true of this hotel. The sheets were disgusting and the room looked as though it should be pay by the hour. We walked into the room, surprised at the potent smell of smoking that only accumulates after years, and gasped at the condition of the bed / floor. We both woke up with what felt like head colds in the morning.. stuffy and with a headache. The overall condition of the inside of the hotel reminded me of one of those movies like Requiem for Dream where people go to score their next fix. Ramada needs to bulldoze this place and put a duck pond in its place. If I'd had the foresight to take pictures of our room there wouldn't be a single person that looked at this review and decided to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad , avoid at all costs , manager lies”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Dark , miserable , unhappy staff , rude staff. Outdated Decor Musty smell You can't even believe the managers comments. I choose the hotel from their own website , there were pictures of a nice pool area , and nice rooms. The pool area was being painted , in attempt to bring the decor into this century. the web site diplayed a nice mural , nice lighting and happy looking people. when my family got there , we waitied ages to be checked-in , there were no goodie bags for the children , (but the manager states that they are available on this own web site). The whole place was dark , the rooms were so dark you needed lights on all time , no outside light at all. Noisy AC , noise fridge , lights in corridor made a strange noise all the time , like buzzing. Really disappointed with this hotel , especially as it looks so nice on their web site. Won't travel there again

Reviews.Title: “Old & outdated”
Reviews.Author: salo41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 8 times in the past 15 years because of the indoor & outdoor pool for the kids as well as a good game room. Unfortunately, it has not been updated in that time. Its been about 4 years since our last visit. Of course the price has dropped, but no longer worth it. The $9 resort fee is insulting. Just because it is old, there is no excuse for it to be dirty. Bathroom pretty bad. Dirty floor corners, mold & mildew in tub area. Carpet stained, blood on bedskirt. Funny smell in room. Cloudy pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Good value cheap hotel close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Madonmickey
Reviews.Content: Having read recent reviews I was sceptical to say the least, however I was pleasantly surprised. Stayed for 18 nights in February 2012. Room was spacious and clean. So close to Disney and great if you are spending all day at the parks and just want a place to lay your head. Staff courteous. Indoor pool a great feature but would benefit from being warmer. Hotel is undergoing maintenance which is required. However if you a looking for a cheap place to stay in a good location, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place”
Reviews.Author: 714Sue
Reviews.Content: Was more than dissappoited horrible Rooms smell like cigs and mold They need to tear this place down

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that I would avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: SUPAGRANDAD
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Ramada for 3 nights but because of the smell in the room and the roaches in the bathroom, we checked out early and drove down to Miami. This hotel needs a thorough clean and specialists brought in to get rid of the roaches. The employee's in the hotel were polite but were not able to sort out the cleanliness to our satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: christy m
Reviews.Content: The only issues I had when staying here was that the room smelled funny, at first we thought it was remains of old smoke, but reading other reviews it must have been mold. The overall look of the hotel was clean, but when you looked further in detail there was plenty to pick out. Neither of the above was intolerable. The price was reasonable for the place, but I don't think a $10/night resort fee is worth it. The bed was comfortable and shower worked great. I am a pool person, so I loved the heated indoor pool. The atrium area was nice, even though there was a chlorine smell, I would be more concerned if there wasn't a smell of chlorine! The brass monkey bar beside the pool was great. Had a great deal 2 for 1 10pm til midnight. and prices were very reasonable. Wifi worked great in the room, and staff very friendly. Didn't eat at the restaurants in the hotel. Overall an ok place for a quick weekend vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Desperately needs work”
Reviews.Author: Miamimami71
Reviews.Content: My main issues with this property are first and foremost--MOLD. This place is full of mold, probably from the indoor pool and the associated humidity. My 2nd issue--security. Anyone can walk right into the hallways from the 2nd floor staircases in spite of a sign saying "no reentry after 6pm". So i was assuming the doors lock behind you when you go outside using these staircases. Well--they dont. This includes the back stairways behind the building leading out to a very dark parking lot in back. Needless to say between the mold and the dark indoor room we were given with the only window looking out over the dark indoor pool area, and the knowledge that any random person from the street could be roaming around the hotels hallways, we did not sleep well. That being said, i realize that this is a budget hotel and you get what you pay for, and i truly believe the hotels mold issues are being caused by the indoor pool area. I dont know if the outside facing rooms are any better as we were only staying the 1 night and had arrived after dark and had dinner plans soon after we checked in, so we really didnt have the energy to make a fuss and change rooms. I did a thorough inspection for bugs and found none. Sheets were clean, blankets looked 10 years old down to threadbare and holes. Carpet was badly in need of replacing, bathrooms need serious updating, but again, budget hotel=budget bathrooms. I dont know what they are planning to do about the mold problem but honestly i dont see it getting any better as long as the indoor pool is there. I wouldnt stay here again. The smell from the moldy room permeated all of our clothes. I could still smell it the next night after we moved over to our timeshare condo. My advice would be--if you must stay here, request an outside facing room and keep your room door latch on. There were also no disabled parking spaces. Isnt that illegal?

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: shazzygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a package.Never again.We opend the door to our room and there was an overpowering smell of mold. Right away we told a housekeeper and she said she would spray. I told her we wanted to move. Checked another room same problem My son started to look around to find where the smell was coming from. The air conditioner was coming away from the wall and we looked inside and it was full of black mold. The toilet tank also black mold. Went to front desk and the girl was laughing at me when I was telling her. Wish I got her name she was the manager on duty on .Very very rude told us to go to the welcome centre and they would find another hotel for us. The guy at the welcome centre told us our only choice was the Orlando Grand which was 35 minuites away but he warned us that hotel had more complaints than the Ramada. We went to check out room #4 finally we found a room that was not smelly and was infact quite clean. The food in th buffet was very limited but ok. The hot tub was very dirty in the morning glad I did not use it. Used the outdoor pool and it was fine. If you have to stay in this place check the room before you pay for it. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Bad”
Reviews.Author: Jim D
Reviews.Content: front desk lady was rude. The pool is filthy and rusty. The whirlpool was half full, not filtering and festing bacteria. Out tub did not drain, took maintenence 1 hr to plunge and snake to get it to drain at 11:00 at night. Out sheets we were given from housekeeping were stuck together and stained. those brown sheets appeared to be over 20 yrs old. Parking lot pitch dark, can't find a light to safely park under, frightening. They had no clean silverware for breakfast, told us and everyone else we had to wait for the diswasher to run a cycle while out food sat on our table and got cold. The sofacouch my kids had to sleep on had springs sticking up into their backs and the matress was 30yrs old stained with unspeakable fluids over the years. Our non-smoking room smelled like mold and smoke. and this was the 2nd room. the front desk 1st gave us an attitude and the wrong room without a sofabed. worst place i've stayed with my family in over 15 years.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: claudia c
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel with my family and was not pleased. The staff is polite and respectful but they look like they don't want to be there themselves. I had to ask for a different room because the first one they gave us smelled like mildew and the panel in front of the vent system was not fully screwed and I could see the accumulation of dust inside. The second room smelled fresh but there were fruit flies (even though we did not have any food in the room). The bed cover had numerous holes in it, it was very old. When asked for other linen, the gentlemen brought us another one with many holes. We mentionned that to him and he told us that they are all like that. There was dried out glue inside the drawers as if someone tried to stick the panels together. There is an indoor pool between the front desk and dining area and it causes a lot of humidity. Maybe their ventilation system is not adequate. The entire hotel needs to be renovated because the location is great. It was cheap, but next time I'll pay more in order to have better accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, would stay again, staff was friendly and very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: koala1605
Reviews.Content: I will say I read all of the reviews and was a bit apprehensive before we arrived for our 4 night stay. We stayed on the 4th floor and our family was across the hall from us. The room was clean, the beds and pillows were super comfortable and we had an inside room with view of the pool and we never heard a thing and did not smell any chlorine.. This is an older hotel and if you want to be picky and look at every nook and cranny of the place I am sure you can find something to complain about. Our niece loved the pool and we enjoyed being able to play pool, have a drink at the end of the night to unwind after a day at the park. We also enjoyed the outside pool. I booked my stay on their web site and found no hidden fees. As a matter of fact when we checked out our bill was $60.00 less than what the online site said. Lets face it, people are booking this place because of the price or they would be staying onsite at one of the parks own resorts. There are tons of places to eat along the road where the hotel is and the prices are much better than you would pay in the actual disney resort. If you book your stay through any other site then the actual hotel site you should blame that site for not informing you of the "fees and taxes"---these fees and taxes are the norm in most hotels in Florida. If you want 5* hotel you should have shelled out the money and paid for a 5* hotel. Just like anything in life --you get what you pay for. We were very happy here and would come back again. Thank you to all of the staff who made our stay a happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: andrew s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night and transfered the next day. When we arrived all you can smell is chlorine, after checking into our room we found 2 single beds instead of a double which we then had to pay an upgrade for. Having lugged our stuff up stairs and gone for food we decided after looking at the resturant buffet pizza was our best option. Having had a long journey we decide to go to bed early only to wake up in the morning and find the carpets were soaking wet and the bathroom was covered in mould. We had to pay around $300 to transfer to a descent hotel and as to date Virgin are still refusing to reinburse us. Do not stay her pay the $7 extra a night and stay in the double trees resort by seaworld. (we were also told by a taxi driver that people live in that hotel perminantely!)

Reviews.Title: “Not too good”
Reviews.Author: kaydayAlabama
Reviews.Content: Rooms are old and musty. Restaraunt buffett is terrible. The pool "waterfall" is over chlorinared wster running from overhead the pool from an old dirty looking pipe. It seems like a deal then they start adding resort fees etc . You are better off somewhere else. Mimi fridge but no micro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Princesse_Becky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights while visiting Orlando. The Hotel has a lot of nice extras, such as shuttles to the parks, indoor & outdoor pool, a restaurant and great staff. The rooms are basic but spacious, which is nice after a whole day out of the Hotel. The front desk and other staff of the Hotel were very nice and welcoming, always happy to help. There was a good choice for Breakfast, I haven't tried lunch or dinner - but will next time. This Ramada is a well located basic Hotel and you will get a good experience for the price you pay. The Hotel could get some updates and I guess it will but at the moment, I would go back and encourage people to stay there if they do not have a budget for a 4 or 5* Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay to explore all the parks”
Reviews.Author: Eva S
Reviews.Content: It was part of an excellent deal and we did not have crazy expectations. The hotel staff was very friendly; the room we got was spacious and very clean. The furniture and carpet are older which was not important to us. The location and their free shuttle to the parks was great. We didn't expect a modern new hotel & amenities, but we found what we were looking for. A quiet, clean room in great location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyn_J081977
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel this January and it's a BAD EXPERIENCE. We are eating our dinner and my husband chewed something. He spit it out to check it and it's a PIECE OF GLASS. We informed the restaurant manager about it. We asked for a copy of the incident but they refuse to give us. We felt like that we weren't treated properly. On my way to our room in the 4th floor, I together with some young adults were stocked inside Elevator A. I would not recommend my friends and families to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the price you pay and the location it was good!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about this hotel after reading the reviews, but now that we have stayed there we would stay there again. It is an older hotel a little outdated, but don't let that discourage you. The price we paid for the room made up for some of the hotel's short comings. If you pay such a low price for a room you can't expect the Ritz-Carlton. The beds were awesome and our sheets were clean, the room refrigerator was helpful, the room was clean, and the staff was super helpful. Yes is is an older hotel and so with that said there are going to be things around the hotel that are not brand new looking such as every tile being perfect or paint on the wall in pristine condition. Many people complained about the smell of chlorine or bleach, well when a place offers and indoor pool it has chlorine in it and there is no open roof for the chlorine to escape so of course it is going to smell like chlorine. We have stayed at other hotels that offered an indoor pool and we paid 3 times the amount and it also smelled the same. Also the indoor pool contributes to some of the condition of the paint and vents. Humidity and chlorine causes metal to rust therefore the pictures of rusty vents and walls with damage come from an indoor pool. I did start to worry but now I can dismiss all the people on here who put the place down. If you want the place to look absolutely perfect then raise the price you are willing to pay for a hotel and go stay some where else, but for the price I don't think the hotel deserves some of the reviews it is getting. We did not get a chance to use the indoor pool or restaurant but next stay we will make time for both.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dacklc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very outdated. Sheets are stained and see through. Non-smoking rooms on 4th floor were smoking rooms and they just changed the signs but did not change carpet and smell is overpowering. Ask to move rooms - they said no. Asked for refund - they said rooms are non-refundable under any circumstances. Avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Must Write its Own Good Reviews”
Reviews.Author: travelorlando82
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to revisit Orlando and its parks as a mature family of four. I had called the hotel directly a couple of days before arriving to inform them of our late arrival (2am). Upon arriving, they did not have a room for us as they thought we were not coming. There was no indication that I had called. They "found" us a room in the kid's wing. My parents received a Dinosaur Themed Room with two bunks, a king sized bed, and a sign indicating "NO ADULTS", while us mid-twenty year old children received a similar room. My brother didn't even fit in the bunks, so we had to share a king sized bed. The rooms were less than adequate. There were stains all over the carpet, mold on the vents, harshly worn furniture, dirty bed spreads and sheets, and the bathroom's mirror and wallpaper had seen better days. We stayed the night in these rooms and then went to the front desk in the morning. They offered us a new room within a few hours and we received a mediocre upgrade (at least adults were allowed). Here is a list of events that occured in the new room: wi-fi was inoperative during peak hours, parent's room not cleaned one day, gum found on blankets, ice bucket tray never cleaned or emptied, front desk phone not answered (forced to head down and little remorse came from the front desk), mold growing in the bathrooms, alarm clock didn't work, stains and cigarette burns in sheets, and multiple spill stains in the drawers. In addition, when our room was cleaned, housekeeping left behind multiple dirty rags they had used to clean the bathroom with. As "luck" would have it, we stayed at the same hotel 20 years ago and it appears as though nothing has changed/been kept up. Try to stay in a newer part of town if possible - this is not a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I was a little worried about staying at this hotel. My fiancee had found a great deal on it, and he told me to not believe everything I read on the internet. On our arrival it took a very long time to check in. The line was long, and once my fiancee got to the check in desk they said we didn't have our reservations. We had paid online a few months in advance. They put us in a room that was supposed to be a family suite. The beds were uncomfortable, and I was old and outdated. We only stayed in the room for a few minutes while he had to log onto our bank account and show them that they had messed up, and our room was paid in full. After proving we had paid they moved us to what was origionally our room. It was also a family suite and was much nicer than the one on the 4th floor we were given at first. We settled in and went to the pool area. It was nice at first glance, but the smell of chlorine was overwhelming. It burnt my eyes in the hot tub. The hot tub's water was not clear, it was white and milky looking. On our 3rd day the hot tub was drained and fresh water was put in. After all of this on our second day there our room key would not let us in the room. Our children and I sat in the floor of the hallway for almost a hour waiting for my fiancee to get a new room key. He had to wait through that long line again. The same thing happened two days later. After being at the parks all day the last thing you want is to not be able to get into your room. We were offered a free breakfast and used it on our last day there. The food was ok, but not something I would want to pay for every morning. There was not even any hot water for the instant oatmeal. To sum it all up...the check in was too long, the first room we were in was not clean and the kids matresses were horrible, the pool was dirty and the whole hotel smelled of chlorine, the staff didn't have any idea what they were doing, and I would never go there again. Yes this is a cheap hotel, but give up $10 and stay somewhere else. I have never had the problems I had with this hotel, and we travel often. The only plus was that it was right off the exit to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, filthy rooms”
Reviews.Author: RJT934
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for eight days. Upon arrival the room smelled like mold and vomit. The carpet was absolutely nasty and filthy dirty. There where multiple stains on the carpet big red circles, I was grossed out. Asked front desk to change rooms and they said were totally booked no empty rooms. The phone didn't work, lights didn't work. Maintenance came to fix those items. Next morning after no sleep due to noise level at night, went to get everyone a shower and absolutely no pressure was a drip along with no hot water was a cold drip. Yes a drip, maintenance had to come fix yet again. After this taken care of was hour late on our schedule that day to Disney. Called multiple times to front desk throughout stay for change in towels, noone answered the phone, it just rang and rang. My husband had to go down in person. The one time someone finally answered they had an attitude and stated "we are busy". After half our time there went to do some laundry. That was a joke. Washer didn't work, had rust in them. The dryer took three times payment to dry my clothes, the one that did work. I attempted to change rooms no one cared to change us. Oh and FYI almost fell numerous times around the pool because lots of bricks broke and loose. When went to check out informed them again of multiple complaints, spoke with manager on duty and he stated "you are on check out complaining, you should of complained when issues arrised" I told him I did and no one would do anything for us. I know am broke out in red raised rashes all over my body and when I checked out I look under for the first time the sink in bathroom just to make sure my kids didn't put anything under there and there was old wet wood. Not a pleasant stay, this hotel is a health concern.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay - Wasnt Bad”
Reviews.Author: cheapies
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in Orlando for one night, prior to flying home from a visit to the Sarasota area. Cost us £30 for a two queen bedded room with full breakfast. This was an amazingly low price so my review will reflect the cost I paid. Location was off I4 and was 20 mins from the Airport. Plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. Checking in was 5 mins. Rooms were a little scruffy and could do with a deep clean and painting. Breakfast was a little slow, this needs looking at long queues to both pay and wait to be seated. Quality was reasonable Indoor pool was good as it was quite cold in Orlando on the day we stayed and there was a bar so you could have a drink while your children played. Sum up totally adequate for a one night stop off and at the price I paid you cannot beat it. Would I stay here as part of a longer trip or use this as a base for my visit to Orlando, no as it felt very low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Was not a hotel I would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Louis K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in good shape. Had an issue with my reservation before I arrived and had to deal with a very rude person in reservations. Checked in to an understaffed front desk. Room does not look anything like the pictures....we had the family room. The frig did not work, no heat and a noisy AC. We would have checked out and stayed somewhere else if we could. Room service was terrible....one day brought no towels, then one day no toilet paper, two days no coffee. Was tired of calling and asking for things that should be standard! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel needs a good scrubbing and updating!”
Reviews.Author: Whendi
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by long lines at the check-in. We were told when making the arrangements that we'd be able to check-in early - this was not the case. The rooms don't appear to have been updated in quite some time. The first room we were given, smelled musty, had stains on both of the bedspreads, dust/grime in the window ledges, and brown stains (water? rust?) in the bathroom sink. We asked for another room and the second room was a bit better - same dated decor - but smelled better and looked a bit cleaner. As we walked down the hall we saw that some of the rooms were really "trashed" by the guests and I'm guessing the hotel is not properly staffed to clean adequately - which still doesn't aswer the question of why stained bedspreads and sinks are considered good enough for their guests. The indoor pool had the entire first floor smelling strongly of chlorine - not good since the buffet is on the first floor. We had vouchers to eat free at the buffet - had dinner at the buffet the first evening and chose not to eat another meal there. (It was adequate at best.) The bed was reasonably comfortable but this is just not a place I'd like to spend a vacation. There are too many chains that offer affordable, clean, comfortable accomodations. After this experience I'm afraid to stay at a Ramada property again.

Reviews.Title: “old nasty rip off lying hotel”
Reviews.Author: pedro l
Reviews.Content: I was there for a christmas weekend and I thaught it was going to be a nice hotel well it is not the rooms do not look like the web page and the heat do not work when you turn heat on cool air blow out.there is a lot of fee that add up for the room like they told me there was fee for tax and resort fee then they said i had to pay a small amount of food then I paid that then when I went to eat I had to pay again then the staff was short cause I did not get any service and then they tell me that what I had paid up front was tax on my food.when i try to use a blow dryer smoke come from the dryer and stop workn

Reviews.Title: “Oldy, moldy”
Reviews.Author: Squid4hire
Reviews.Content: We booked the "Kids Suite" for Christmas week. When we arrived we were excited to begin our vacation week. Upon arrival we were told there was no rooms available and would need to wait. 30 minutes later we received a room and headed for it. In the 30 minutes we had to kill we scouted out the indoor pool. Looked fine but as we walked around my daughter tripped near the pool. We discovered there were many loose bricks in the floor all around the pool. Dangerous for kids. When we arrived in the room we looked around and made a quick decision not to unpack. The carpet was disgusting in the room. My wife would not let the kids take their shoes off. It looked ratty and dirty. Further inspection turned up moldy ceilings, bathroom sink, mirror, floor boards, air vents, and more. The furniture was ratty and worn. Our 2 year old jumped on the bunk beds and pulled the pillow away from the wall at the head of the bed. Behind the pillow was an open power outlet! Very safe for kids?? We had enough and went out to look for another hotel. Returned and checked out immediately. They told us me "might" get charged for a nights stay. We better not. Ramada, this place need help!!

Reviews.Title: “Positives and Negatives”
Reviews.Author: Moonacres
Reviews.Content: Like all Hotels and places to stay there are negatives and positives so lets start with the negatives. The coridors are in desparate need of a revamp, even a lick of paint would make a huge difference. It appears from the ceiling tiles there have been some leaks, this must contribute to the damp musty smell. With the pool being in the main part of the building there is an elemnt of clorine smell around. Not brilliant whilst having breakfast. The second problem with that is people come out of the poolk and straight into the eleventors making the floors sometimes slippery. Please be mindfull if you are unsteady on your feet. Next the room, Room 7034 is an inside room facing onto the dining and pool areas. Although not the best view in town it's acceptable, being inside and with mirrored glass makes the room dark and always requireing some of the lights on. The fridge is in the base of the TV cabinet which like the table and the cabinets in the bathroom require replacing. The shower curtain rail requires fixing properly as it is curved over time it had become unscrewed and now hangs down so the curtain moves to the middle not good when the shower is at one end of the bath tub. Housekeeping., Initially yhr housekeeping was accectable but as our stay progressed it deteriated dramatically. Let me give you some examples. Dirty towels left as if they were clean ones. We requested a bed change part way through the stay, leaving as requested the "you help the enviroment" sign on the bed. I'm not convinved it was changed. Our room's bin had not been cleared for 3 days and room service had not been in for 2 days. We know this as the bed in particular we had left made but not fully straightened out under the main cover. In a way it was a way of checking if anything was done properly. I had to complain as to me this is not acceptable, The day I made the complaint to reception they had not been in even to replace the coffee and cups. The toilet cistern has not been wiped down for a long time as there are marks on the top and the side that we tried and could remove quite easily. In the main sleeping / sitting area the corner floor lamp hasn't been dusted, wiped or cleaned in quite some time given the film of dust / muck. It may seem that I am being very critical but these points of hotel housekeeping are just basic fundamental ones. The day I complained regarding the 2nd days none room service the excuse was that we had the do not disturbe sign on the door, even though we were out of the room by 11am each day, poor excuse for poor housekeeping. I eventually had a quick meeting with the general manager ( sorry can not remember his name) explaining my concerns and disappointments pointing out that as a regular traveler and frequent hotel guest I regularly read and write reviews for this site and others and would most definatley be putting a review on his hotel on this occasion. I did offer for him to read what I had written so far and before I was to publish it. He said no thank you and was sure that what I was about to put would be honest and true. I did also explain that the previous review of the hotle I was hoping that they would turn out to be untrue but unfortunatley not so. He agreed to give me some recompence for the poor service we had received and he said he would be speaking to the housekeeping manager that day to ensure that the problems were put right. True to his word he did and although there was some improvement and they made the pillows look all fancy etc there was still the dust, still the mucky marks in the bathroom but coffee and cups were of sufficient supply. As we were checking out the following morning early on I could not be bothered to start again. I would have thought if a hotel guest had complained they they would have made a concerted effort even just for that once. Now that rant is over I have a couple of thing to be aware of. 1, Phone calls from the room, I made 3, two of which told me that I had to put a 9 in front of the number I was dialing, these totalled each $3.77 + tax full total $13.02 and a final call to a house I could have driven to within 15 minutes door to door that cost me $11.93 total $24.95. It would have cost me a lot less to have driven it. Apparentyly 1 - 2 two towns away is long distance. 2, The bar area, we tried it one night, to us it didn't feel appealing or welcoming now maybe thats because we were the only once in but still id dint feel like a bar atmosphere again with the smell of the pool. We have both filled out the customer survey cards for the hotel and I now wonder if it is going to change in any way. Out of curiosity I will keep reading any further reviews. Would I stop at this hotel again? I very much doubt it unless there was significant improvement. As always I keep an open mind and very rarely say never again. Would I stay in another Ramada? well yes as I have in the past in USA and NZ and the UK. Some say you get what you pay for but I have been in cheaper hotels and got far better service. It's not or should not be what you pay but what you get for your money that counts. I look forward to seeing if the General Manager puts a reply on this review. I hope so for the benefit of other potential travellwers and Hotel guests. NOTE. AFTER 15 + WORKING DAYS THE DEPOSIT AND THE MONEY AS REFUND HAS STILL NOT BEEN CREDITED INTO MY ACCOUNT. It does specify that it would be after 10 working days. Positives, Great central location for all the theme parks and the I4 to go west or east although don't expect a great night life. The 192 has all the shops you need for a stay. Look around and pop into Celebration for a feel of the Desparate Housewifes. Old Town has some sort of entertainment on every night of the week. Fri & Sat Muscle car and all American car shows. Bike shows and others. Back to the hotel, The hotel bed was fantasticly comfy and the pillows just the right sort of firmness formme and my good lady. The bedroom size was good and the bathroom was of an accceptable level. Don't leave it too late for a shower or bath, water goes cool fairly early on. The amount of storage space was adequate with enough hangers for two people. Good to have an Iron and board in the room even for those tidy bag packers. TV is a good size, If youn arrive by vehicle there is adequate free parking, however durung summer or busy periods I am sure that would get tight. I hope that this review will be of use to all those people thinking of using the hotel and look forward to the comments from others and the staff concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, not all that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Shawn K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights with three kids leaving Christmas day 2011. In all honesty this is an older hotel. You have to expect wear and tear within the property itself. There is a reason the prices are as cheap as they are. Obviously they are not going to spend millions in renovations. The "family suite" was clean enough for our family, rooms were made, and clean towels brought daily. Property felt very safe and I left my laptop out the entire trip right on top of the dresser without any problems. Would I stay here again? Probably not, just because the wife and I decided next year we are going to spend a little extra to stay right on property of one of the amusement parks. This has nothing to do with the hotel itself. Staff was very friendly and anytime we had an issue (one day we had no wash cloths) they were immediately at our door. So if your looking to save some money on your trip and want a clean room to sleep in, Ramada might be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Dirty & NOT A RAMADA!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyTyV
Reviews.Content: When I booked this through a travel site it said it was a 3 star. For the price, I thought you couldn't beat it. I thought, hum..Ramada..can't be that bad. I knew something was wrong when I turned into what said Ramada and they gave me a funny look and told me to go across the street. I was nervous turning in..and not even a minute in the lobby i was just really hoping I was just being over critical. NOT EVEN CLOSE!! There was water dripping from the ceiling in the lobby and there was a bad smell (probably coming from the indoor pool) evident. There was water everywhere..all in the elevator also probably from the indoor pool. What a hazard. I got in the room and it was beyond awful. Dirty sheets, nasty vents and obviously in bad need of renovation. I even opened the drawer and found a big box of crackers. The fridge wasn't even working. It was a nightmare. They moved me to another room. It was a little better..but still not clean. There was food particles on the bed post, hair and dirt every where in the bathroom. Crayons and stains on the sheets. To make matters worse, something was going on with the plumbing and something came loose in the hallway almost dripping water or some type of fluid in the hallway. Needless to say I only stayed in that room that night because I had no choice, but promptly switched hotels as soon as the sun came up. I don't understand how this place is still in business, why it has the name Ramada and why it's labeled 3 star! I will say that the staff was extremely friendly and both supervisors were very nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place, would stay again..”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: We stay at in a lot of places in our travels. This Hotel was just fine for the price and location. We had one of the older rooms that has not been upgraded. However, the room was very clean. Our room was off the pool area so didn't hear any noises. The front staff was very nice and helpful. We come to visit parks and people so dont stay in the rooms much, but the room was good for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “have to be honest”
Reviews.Author: kyle m
Reviews.Content: at first you get a mixed feeling on this place but it has some good qualities and some bad but from what I have learned there is a new owner that is willing to put money into it and the room I received was a newer remodeled room but I have stayed in different rooms in this hotel that's why i gave the average I gave, instead of a better grade the newer room was very good had a flat screen TV in all a nice room. other rooms there need improvements but are clean I have noticed that the people there seem to be friendlier than in the past the food is still sub pare but it is a little better than last year Ive been there the three years in a row so I did notice the improvement in service. good location to good local restaurants, shuttles seem to be regular, myself I rent cars to take full advantage of what Florida has to offer there is more to Florida than Disney

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the other reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: BecciS
Reviews.Content: After booking my stay at this hotel I read the reviews and was extremely nervous about my stay at the Maingate West. However when the 7 of us arrived at the hotel, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful in assisting us. When I booked there was only a smoking room available however the reception staff managed to put me in a non smoking room which was brilliant. They were helpful in booking taxis for our nights out and helping us make arrangements for coachs and day's out. The lady working in the shop was also very knowledgable about the local area and offered advise on where to eat and gave us some vouchers. Scott, one of the bar staff, was also great at offering advice and introduced us to the best steakhouse ever called Charley's. The bar is also very clean and a great price on drinks with two happy hours. The rooms were cleaned every day. In need a bit of modernising but it's a bed to stay in at night as we were out most the day. The location is great, lots of food places around and not too far from any of the attractions such as Disney and Universal. We got a taxi back from Universal which is the furthest away and cost about $40. I can't comment on the food there as we didn't eat in the hotel, but it always seemed to have people in it. There were a few problems along the way, one of our rooms had a cockroach in and my friends had to move. However they cleared the old room straight away. Our air conditioning was very loud one evening, but the hotel maintainence arrived quickly and sorted out the problem swiftly (a loose pipe). Yes the walls are paper thin, and it is need of a bit of modernising but not anything of great concern, it's just a little dated. Don't be put off by the bad reviews, it's not a 5* luxury hotel, but it's a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why is there so much animosity toward this place???”
Reviews.Author: razorfish355
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Travelocity and got nervous after reading so many poor reviews. We arrived late last night for an overnight stay. The Front desk attendant was friendly and courteous. The room we got (4th floor) was in good shape compared to other places we've stayed in Orlando. No smell of mold, mildew, or bugs. Indeed, there is the scent of chlorine in the lobby...using my amazing deductive capabilities I assumed it was from the indoor pool, which was an absolute pleasure and clean as a whistle. Fresh sheets, ice cold AC, and hot shower...By morning, I was still actually looking for problems, totally paranoid by other reviews. I am not saying people are lying. Not at all. I was miffed at the $10 resort fee; it would be nice if Travelocity told people about that in advance. Perhaps there have been bad experiences in the past. Perhaps people are expecting this place to be a 5 star Westin resort. But for the price and location, I could expect nothing better. I would definitely stay here again and wish this place and its people the best.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: legomandan
Reviews.Content: Its not the ritz carlton but it is a great deal at a great location. We were headed to Legoland but it is right on top of Disney. My daughter loved the pool and the staff were nice every time we interacted with them. Rooms had little dings and defects but were clean and they even arranged all my daughters stuffed animals real cute every time they made the bed. Even with a room on the outside of the hotel (not poolside) it was a little damp but the AC took care of it in 15 minutes. For $40 a night with a really fun pool area I'd come back again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in every way”
Reviews.Author: Sun1968
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap in every way. Unattractive and outdated lobby in dire need of TLC. Stale rooms - but clean. Weird indoor pool-buffet area, not attractive. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kristyn v
Reviews.Content: I was VERY skeptical about staying here after reading the reviews, but didn't have much choice since another family member booked it. Upon entering the hotel the lobby does smell of chlorine, but the pool is very close and that is to be expected. The lobby and pool area were very clean. The staff at the desk were wonderful and very helpful, Raymond was great and very willing to help. We stayed in one of the kid suites with our two sons. The bedding was clean and fresh, other than a couple of the fleece blankets were very coarse. When asked to get a couple of soft blankets, staff delivered them quickly. We ate a couple of times at the buffett--kids do eat free, but drinks were separate. Food on the buffet was good and fresh. Did not eat at the Pizza Hut. The room was clean...a few edges of the furniture looked rough, but the hotel is being remodeled. The room was clean and the housekeepers do a good job. We stayed there for a week. I would DEFINETELY stay here again. I am very picky about cleanliness when staying in a hotel and was very pleased. We asked to stay in the new section of the hotel that had been remodeled, one of the tips read on here. No bugs, no filth, no troublemakers loitering....very close to all attractions. We are planning another trip for next summer and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: paul82h
Reviews.Content: Close to Disney, family suites are convenient if travelling with children, advertised Pizza Hut does not exist, bar expensive, lots of places to eat close by, budget hotel, does exactley what it says on tin!

Reviews.Title: “my stay at ramada maingate west”
Reviews.Author: mae s w
Reviews.Content: my husband and i always stay at this ramada which is often. the staff is always courteous, and our rooms are clean and neat. it afforded us the stress free getaway we needed. we have never had a bad experience at this ramada, our room was available when we checked in. the most important is the closeness to all of the theme parks, many restaurants within the area without having to drive any distance to get there. i especially liked the price which was in my price range for a hotel, that i will only be in at night. suggestion: take some of the tourist infor stations off the tv and add more movie channels.

Reviews.Title: “falling apart”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany G
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that the staff was really friendly, and as helpful as they could be, they also informed us that this hotel was recently sold to a major hotel company which means all the problems will probably get fixed at some point. The first room they tried to put us in had a hole in the wall that had been "repaired" badly. Also there was mold growing around the window frame. We asked to be moved to s different room, which they did quickly and happily. The new room had no hole in the wall but still had mold growing around the window and a broken electrical socket behind the bed so that every time you leaned on the head board it would make the bedside lamp turn off. The lighting was dark and/or flickering, the carpet in the room was stained in one area, the floors in the hallways were bumpy and uneven, you can see next to the room doors where non smoking or smoking signs had previously been torn off the walls. It looks like no one has bothered to clean the glass wall of the elevator in months. The place is just skeevy, we didn't even go in the pool or hot tub because we were afraid we might catch something.

Reviews.Title: “Need all new staff for entire hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disneyvacationer99
Reviews.Content: When I first tried booking my room I called the hotel to do it and could never get a hold of the reservation lady, but did hear many excuses. When calling the hotel six time the person at the check in desk picked the phone up and then just hung it up. I could hear her talking before she hung up. I then called and talked with the 800 number after many tries and got booking information from them and found it to be cheapest to book online through the Ramada website. After booking I called to make sure everything was okay and was told yes I can check in anytime after 3:00 P.M. We were staying there for one night for the Mickey's not so scarey holloween party, which started at 7:00 p.m that evening. After the kids got out of school we arrived at hotel around 5:00 to find out that the reservation lady never entered our reservations into the computer even know they were made online and not with her. They said it would take 20 to 40 minutes and to come back. I told them we have four kids who need to get ready for the holloween party and we need to leave in an hour. They told us to have the kids get dressed in the public bathrooms in the lobby. Then we are told that there is also a 50 dollar fee for each room for incidents. I told them that no one I talked to and not even there website states anything about this charge. We booked two rooms and I told them that there is not enough money on card after paying for the rooms and we needed to eat while there. They then said well then we can't book you, you'll have to go somewhere else. After a brief panic attack and the people next to us having the same argument with them, they decided to only charge us 25 dollars a room. They say the hold on the charge releases when you check out, but for a debit card it can take 21 days to release. We finally get into our rooms and are sadly an hour late to the Mickey's Holloween Night. Now about the hotel rooms, food and pool. The rooms are descent expect the bed spreads were dirty, but we never sleep with them anyway. The indoor pool was heated, but not very well as kids were cold since the lobby was freezing even though it was 50 something outside. The chlorine in hot tub and pool were way too strong, they should switch to salt pool. The buffet was not good at all, the only good thing was kids 12 and under eat free. The sandwhich and pizza hut express still wasn't open at 2:00 in the afternoon and the arcade is a joke. The games take your money and no one at hotel can get it back for you and the game aren't worth the hassle anyway. My husband and I did enjoy playing pool at the tiki bar that is located right next to the indoor pool while the kids swam ( kids all twelve and older and were in plain sight). Tiki bar isn't opened till evening time which is great for families with kids that are using the indoor pool area during the morning and day. Check in and check out hours are better than most hotels and the pictures are exact to what the hotel looks like. We did have a problem with a group of handicapped adults where a woman chaperone brought one of the males into the ladies room while our teen girls were in there and he came out of stall with pants down and all showing. Yikes! the girls ran out!!!! Needs to be a sign that no males are allowed in girls bathroom!!!!!!!! They need more staff and with better personalities, except I have to say the gentlemen that checked us out was way better than the women that checked us in. For the price and indoor pool during cold months it is worth staying here. You need to check and double check your reservation. Don't use the bed spreads. Eat outside of the hotel, many places on same street. Book on priceline or one of the online booking sites because if you do then the hotel can't charge you the 50 dollar incident hold on the room. Avoid having to use the front desk women for anything. We had a late check out of 1:00 and at twelve they still shut our keys off and acted bothered when we had to get new keys. Rude rude rude rude! Last thing, when we mentioned they should put the 50 dollar hold fee on there website so people know, the manager said she would let the owner know. My husband then said, "like that will do any good," and the manager said, "No, it won't." If you don't have the money then this is where to stay, it is fine if you just take the advice I gave. P.S. Waitress at buffet was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not WhatWe Expected of A Virgin Atlantic Holiday Destination”
Reviews.Author: DerickE
Reviews.Content: We arrived 21st October, 2011 and found the room had a musty smell to it. As it was late we didn't inspect the room until next morning. The window frame was absolutely disgusting in that it had cob webs around it and there were big gaps between it and the wall. The frame should have been condemned years ago with the look of it and who knows what might be crawling in through those gaps. The air conditioning grille was rusty and the control for the air con. was loose on the wall and sparks came from it when it fell off the wall. The bathroom door would not close and the vanity sink tap would not turn off properly (dripping all the time). The top covers on the beds had numerous cigarette burns in them even though it was supposed to be a non smoking room. The bed valance had tears in it and was fraid. As it was Saturday the hotel staff could not move us until the Monday because there were no free rooms (after looking at two other rooms they had offered but these were in no better condition). On the Monday we moved to a different room but after moving in we noticed that the carpet was wet through and the following morning were moved again because the maintenance staff wanted to find out where the carpet waqs getting wet from. The next room had a faulty safe and we had to wait a couple of days for the replacement door to be fitted for it. All around the indoor swimming pool there are floor tiles that are loose, cracked and in a dangerous condition for children to play around. I am writing this on the 27th October, 2011 with still 8 more days to put up with what I call a disgusting hotel provided by Virgin Atlantic Holidays and upon returning to England I will take this matter up with them. I have taken photos of the first room as evidence of where Virgin sent us and as previously mentioned I am far from happy with this hotel. One positive I have about the hotel is that the staff are very polite and did try to resolve the problems but what can they do when they haven't got the an acceptable hotel to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Best management team n kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: ladiesheaven
Reviews.Content: There no other hotel I would stay in while n kissimmee area.

Reviews.Title: “Family and budget friendly.”
Reviews.Author: travelingcatz
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and smooth. The gentleman helping me was very friendly and accommodating to my list of requests for my room. You should note that pets are allowed at this hotel so if you have allergies be sure to mention it. I picked this hotel only because it was close to where some buddies were staying. The hotel has an indoor swimming pool and hot tub which the families seemed to enjoy. I did not expect much as the rate per night was cheap. I just hoped there were no bed bugs or cockroaches. The room needed updating and the shower did not drain. The shower was promptly fixed. The housekeeping staff did a good job keeping my room clean during my six night stay. I felt safe and everyone in the hotel was very friendly. Majority of them were families checking out the Disney Parks. The hotel offered shuttle service to Sea World and Universal Studios. The do not have shuttles to the Disney parks. The taxi ride to disney should be around USD $20.00. If you have the hotel order you a taxi, make sure it is a yellow cab and not a town car. The town car is more expensive-they charged me $30 to get to Magical Kingdom...this is day light robbery. The hotel also had free wifi. Also important to know that the hotel charges a resort fee of USD $10.00 a night. I'm not sure what that was for but I had to pay it even though I did not use their pool and breakfast was not included or a free bottle of water. There is however a grocery store across the street and a few restaurants to pick from within walking distance. Also you have a mini fridge in your room. Reminder that this is a budget hotel. It needs updating but it's quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, great rate”
Reviews.Author: cathybrady
Reviews.Content: Convenient, great price.........always stay here when traveling to Disney, Universal Studios or just going over that way for a weekend get-away

Reviews.Title: “Went for Epcot food and wine festival”
Reviews.Author: Iluv2travel59
Reviews.Content: The room was okay for the value and we were only in it to sleep and shower so it served our purpose since we were at the park all day and night. Our only complaint is there was no water pressure when you took a shower. To get water pressure you had to take a barley lukewarm shower. The beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “not very good”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: The room had a leak (it was raining a lot)on the outside wall where the bunk beds were, and the top bunk, the guard rail kept falling off, so the child that was supposed to sleep there couldn't. We told the staff, but the impressions we got was they didn't really care, and didn't offer any help. Never again. !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOULDN'T STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: patpathendersonky
Reviews.Content: The bathroom had roaches, also, we had to call security because of a sexual incident taking place in the hallway on Saturday night. We had stayed at this hotel last year and was quite happy, but will not stay at this property again. The price was cheap and sometimes you get what you pay for !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Experience....Would Stay Here Again Over Disney Value Resorts”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Disney Value Resorts for the past 5 years with my parents also having a room to sleep 1 of our 3 boys. However, since they've trimmed the FREE Meal Plan down to NO TABLE SERVICE included, we "boycotted" staying at a Disney resort this year.
