Bought a Half-Off Depot 4-day/3-night stay at this Ramada for $79. Then I read the reviews and tried to prepare the family for the worst. Turns out, our fears were unfounded. We THOROUGHLY enjoyed our time at this Ramada! Although we had to pay the $10 per day hotel service charge/Disney shuttle fee, we never used it since we drove to Florida. But we also only spent one day at a Disney park this year (A.K.) and decided to explore more of the Orlando area with the rest of our days & nights. This turned out very well and our 3 boys (10,10, 8) also enjoyed Disney Quest, Green Meadows Petting Farm, Dave & Buster's, Outlet Shopping and the freedom to eat wherever we wanted instead of feeling the pressure of stuffing ourselves at Disney buffets... PROS: Cheap stay, saved HUNDREDS over staying at Disney; in-room mini refrig (Disney charges extra for this at Value Resorts); FREE Wi-Fi throughout the resort and easy to connect; CLEAN Indoor Pool & Hot Tub (our boys LOVED this & we visited the pool/tub 6 times); 3 beds for 3 children & 2 TVs in our Family Fun Suite; nice location in what our boys nicknamed "Little Vegas" for all the lights on the strip at night; our room overlooked the pool/restaurant area; FREE USA TODAY every morning in the lobby; the clean aroma of Chlorine/Bleach from the moment we walked into the resort; kids eat free at the buffet; our maid was exceptional and we tipped her daily. CONS: Didn't take a blow dryer because the rooms have one and of course ours didn't work (but we lived without it); spent 5 minutes cleaning the in-room coffee maker that contained dirty water before noticing the on/off switch on the front bottom was missing (D'oh!); the 2 tv remotes would sometimes control both tvs at the same time when that wasn't desired (but this is really a minor complaint). Obviously the specific room you get will greatly influence your experience at this (or any) resort....Our expectations were set very low and since nearly everything exceeded them while being an extremely affordable stay, this Ramada earned 5-stars with us...

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: angelahag
Reviews.Content: My Husband and two Son's (19 and 22) were at a ball tournament and stayed here. Now the ball team stayed here a month ago with no complaints and I am happy to say for the money and location you should disregard the bad reviews. This hotel is only a few minutes from the Disney ESPN Wide World of Sports complex and by a few I mean roughly five or less. I think no matter where you stay you can find fault in a hotel, but over all the guys had no complaints and for the money you can't beat $33 a night for 2 queen beds with a refridge! They loved the deep outdoor pool, plenty of cable channels, comfy beds oh and I can't forget the arcade :) I think of it this way...as long as the room is bearable, that just leaves you extra money to do other things especially while in Orlando. This place looks not the greatest from the photo's, but it really is not bad. The staff was nice and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard all bad reviews, This hotel offers great quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: slkd2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Maingate West from this past weekend and was extremely satisfied with the hotel and the services offered. This hotel offers rates as low as $35 per night and the service is way beyond this price. The room was meticulously cleaned and a great size. My family and I ate breakfast at the buffet style restaurant every morning during our stay and I must say that the restaurant employees were wonderful. I have to give special mention to Yissel and another woman (I didnt get her name, but I do know she has been working there for 20+ years). They were just so nice, it was a breath of fresh air. The food at the restaurant was very low priced and tasty too! My family and I had so much fun in the indoor pool, located right near the restaurant. There were also several other families there that were all having an excellent time. The hotel is conveniently located about a mile away from all the Disney Parks, which was awesome because we could wake up, take our time getting ready and take a short drive to Disney vs. having to wake up in a rush to take the park shuttle. The hotel also offers an outdoor pool, gym, bar and pizzahut express, which we unfortunately did not have time to take advantage of. The one and only negative comment I have is regarding the front desk staff. They could definitely have been a lot nicer to the guests. I'm not saying I was treated bad per se, but there was no eye contact or smiling involved in my check-in or check-out and thats something that I feel is neccessary for a person to really feel welcome at an establishment. All in all, we had a fabulous stay at the Ramada Maingate West. I am a Disney annual pass holder and will definitely be staying here for all my future visits to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Nice Location Nice pool”
Reviews.Author: eloozhun
Reviews.Content: The staff is very polite and helpful and the indoor pool area is nice. The rooms are clean the hotel is solid. They are making improvements in the next few weeks including rooms and repainting. The location great for all the parks easy to find right off I and 192 plently of food choices and easy to get too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: dixiekslady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times in the past. We like to join in on the nightly karaoke, when we checked in we found that the owners had changed and they stopped the karaoke. we were disappointed because this is the reason we chose to stay here and usually the rooms are clean. we like the inside whirlpool and pool also. After checking in we went to the room and it smelled like old mildew, the air was turned down to 55 on the thermostat that is was cold and condinsation was on the air vent. I spray the room with febreeze to help cover the smell at least we were only staying for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Cock Roaches!!”
Reviews.Author: Willchappell1
Reviews.Content: Am currently staying, on first inspection you will notice everything needs a bit of work and a good clean, including the night reception staff who is wearing somebody else's gravy stained suit which is about three sizes too big. The hotel is run down more than grotty, the rooms are clean but our first room developed a few bugs. The first 5 or 6 is just squashed. On return from a restaurant one night to find a large cock roach under the duvet cover just wouldn't cut it with my girlfriend! So with very little hassle we were moved to another room. They are so used to moving people around they don't even put up any resistance. The new room is better, but still damp in the bathroom, loose bathroom wall tiles and mouldy silicone around the bath seems to be the norm. Wouldn't give this place a three star, two at best. All in all it's cheap, and we are not letting it ruin our holiday. As long as the bugs stay away we are pretty happy.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic for price and location”
Reviews.Author: imhavingthem
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how cheap this place was, especially after I saw it. It's a totally great hotel. I would def stay there again. Very convenient to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Disney on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: tammyv
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a last minute get away to Orlando, we allowed Expedia/hotwire to book us a 3 star hotel. We were very happy with the rate, the cleanliness and the quality of the hotel but I dont think it is a 3 star, maybe a 2.5 at best, my only complaint was the resort fee, it is required by every guest to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Rashid A
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 2nd floor and I am very pleased. No issues

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the naysayers!!! I loved it :-)”
Reviews.Author: Future_NC_MD
Reviews.Content: Myself, my sister, and my cousin stayed here the 3rd week of May. I wanted to make sure I wrote a review for this hotel. Let me start off by saying I’m somewhat hard to please, I take customer service very seriously, and I’m very detailed oriented. Let’s just say, I see it all AND I’ve seen it all. With that being said, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The only complaints that I have are minute. I didn’t like that there were kids all over the place. At night, they stayed in the Jacuzzi past the cut off time of 9 pm. One morning, a foreigner put her panties in the microwave and set off the fire alarm in the entire hotel. Also, I think that the music at the outside pool could have been much louder. I had to strain to hear what they were playing at 12 o’clock noon. I was on vacation and wanted to feel like that. I felt more like I was in an elevator, than on vacation laying out by the pool in 90 degree weather. See, miniscule issues. I thoroughly enjoyed myself, they’re food, drinks, and most of all Karaoke. I will never forget the “Hey there Delilah” rendition that one of the guys staying there, offered up. Hilarious stuff!!! I did not see any mold, roaches, or bedbugs. Nothing! And I have stayed in a bug infested hotel before. Not fun at all. This hotel, the room was meticulously cleaned. I did have to call and have them come and change our bed linen b/c there was black streaks on the sheet and pillow. Housekeeping was there in a heartbeat and changed everything that was on that bed, not just the stained sheet. Everything. Housekeeping was so on top of it, the next day they literally begged to clean the room by knocking on the door every hour and a half. I finally had to get up and go to the pool and get some sun. Hey, at least they wanted to clean. I loved that checkout was so late, I think 12 noon. You can’t beat that. I must say, I was like most of you. I was so worried about staying here because of the horrible reviews and reputation. We were part of Bahamas Celebration and got to stay at one hotel before the cruise and one hotel after the cruise. We could not choose. I am so happy with the Ramada Maingate West that, I would stay here again all on my own. The other hotel we stayed at was horrible and they have a negative review coming their way. This Ramada has a pizza hut, tiki bar, karaoke, restaurant, gift shop, bar, exercise room, etc. What else can you ask for? They are also in a perfect location. Close to everything. If you want 5 stars, go stay at Disney. If you want convenience and an economical choice, choose Ramada Maingate West.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Maingate West
HotelInfo.Address: 7491 West Hwy 192, Kissimmee, FL 34747
